roleset.name: take willingly
roleset.note: ACCEPT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'accept' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus. VerbNet entries approve-77, characterize-29.2-1-1, and obtain-13.5.2. (from accept.01-v)

ACCEPTANCE-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry accept.01, ON acceptance-n senses 1, 2, 3, 4; maps to VN classes approve-77, characterize-29.2-1-1, and obtain-13.5.2. Framed by Claire. (from acceptance.01-n)

example.name: transitive agentive
example.text: The companies prevent [them]-1 from *trace*-1 accepting our superior cash offer.

example.name: with donor
example.text: He wouldn't accept anything of value from those he was writing about.
example.arg: from those he was writing about

example.name: with attribute
example.text: There are [many practices]-1 historically accepted *trace*-1 as normal here.

example.name: NP only, args 0 & 1
example.text: government acceptance of its bid for control of Jaguar
example.arg: of its bid for control of Jaguar

example.name: Acceptance of idea
example.text: Their acceptance of the literal truth of the Bible made them reject any theory of natural evolution.
example.arg: of the literal truth of the Bible

example.name: Arg 0 as PP
example.text: After three rejections, his acceptance to Harvard came as a surprise to John.

example.name: With attribute
example.text: The acceptance of the baby as her own required the lamb to smell the same as the ewe's own offspring.

example.name: With Source
example.text: In accordance with our acceptance of funds from the U.S. Treasury, cash dividends on common stock are not permitted without prior approval from the U.S.

roleset.name: worthy of accepting
roleset.note: ACCEPTABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1. Relation to verb-accept.01. (from acceptable.01-j)

example.name: All args
example.text: She was acceptable to the Confederates, who allowed her through to Andersonville.
example.arg: to the Confederates, who allowed her through Andersonville.

example.name: args 1, 3
example.text: An out of state license is acceptable as a second form of ID, but not as proof of your legal name and date of birth.
example.arg: as a second form of ID

example.name: args1, 2
example.text: How much noise is acceptable from an upstairs neighbor?
